full_job_description:
General Operative
Site Labouring
Overnight stays may be required
Must have full clean driving licence. Driving to and from site will be required.
Leicester LE3
Temp to Perm
Hours of work
0800 - 1630
Mon - Friday
Starting pay rate - £12.50 per hour
Are you an experienced Site Labourer or general operative with some Engineering Experience? If yes, read on....
My client is a large manufacturing company based in Leicester. They are currently searching for a new General operative /site labourer to join their team. Commutable from areas including Leicester, Beaumont Leys, Wigston, Hinckley and surrounding areas
The Role -
General Operative /site labourer
- Driving to and from site - must have full clean driving licence
- Moving and installing machinery on customers premises
- Following installation instructions
- Communicating with customers on all levels
Minimum Skills / Experience Required -
General Operative/Site labourer
- Experience in site work
- Must have full clean driving licence
- Awareness of health and safety legislation
- Able to work onsite all around the country
- Able to stay overnight when required
- Good communication skills
- Willingness to take further appropriate training
- Highly Motivated
The Package - General Operative/site labourer
- Starting rate of £12.50
About Precision People
Precision People is a leading recruitment agency that specialises in sourcing top talent for Engineering, Technical, Sales and Senior Management roles across a wide range of industries. With a focus on precision and quality, their team of expert recruiters works tirelessly to match the best candidates with the right employers, ensuring that both parties benefit from a successful partnership.
Precision People has the expertise and resources to help you find the perfect role. With a deep understanding of the industry and a commitment to excellence, they have built a reputation for delivering exceptional results and exceeding their candidates expectations.
Interested?
To apply for the General operative/site labourer position, here are your two options:
1. "This is the job for me! When can I start?" - Call now and let's talk through your experience. Ask for Sharon Pickering on (phone number removed) between 8.30am - 5.30pm.
2. "I think I'm right for this position, but I'm not sure I have enough to get an interview" - Click "apply now" so I can read your CV and let you know.

They are currently looking for new Production Supervisor to run their fabrication workshop. Commutable from Coventry, Hinckley, Rugby, Nuneaton and other areas close to South Leicestershire. salary_benefits: £40,000 - £50,000/annum. Competitive salary and benefits package.
full_job_description: **Quality Engineer**   Up to £50k (depending on experience)   Are you a detail-driven Quality Engineer with a passion for continuous improvement and a strong understanding of ISO standards? This is an exciting opportunity to join a forward thinking electronics manufacturer, where you'll play a key role in driving quality excellence across all areas of the business.   **About the Role**   As a Quality Engineer, you'll take ownership of the company's Quality Management System (QMS), ensuring compliance to ISO 9001 and supporting implementation of ISO 14001 and ISO 45001 standards. You'll lead both internal and external audits, oversee non conformance processes, and provide hands-on support across the business to promote a culture of quality and continuous improvement.   Working closely with production, suppliers, and customers, you'll manage warranty investigations, ensure compliance with environmental and safety regulations, and help maintain the highest levels of product integrity.   **Key Responsibilities**   - Administer, develop and maintain the company QMS in line with ISO 9001 standards. - Support implementation and compliance with ISO 14001 and ISO 45001. - Conduct and manage internal and external quality audits. - Manage non-conformance reporting, root cause analysis and 8D corrective actions. - Handle warranty adjudication - including receipt, assessment and logging. - Support the development and documentation of SOPs and business processes. - Drive continuous improvement through lean and problem-solving methodologies. - Ensure customer and supplier compliance with standards such as REACH, RoHS and ESG. - Prepare and manage quality documentation including PPAP, APQP, Control Plans, FMEA and SQA processes. - Facilitate and support external audits and compliance checks. **About You**   My Client are looking for someone who brings:   - Proven experience within a Quality Engineering role, ideally in an electronics or manufacturing environment. - Strong understanding of ISO 9001, with exposure to ISO 14001 and ISO 45001. - Experience with PLM/ERP systems and customer compliance standards (REACH, RoHS, ESG). - A tenacious, detail-oriented approach and commitment to "right first time" quality. - Excellent problem-solving skills with experience in root cause analysis and corrective actions. - A proactive attitude towards continuous improvement and customer satisfaction. **Why Join Them?**   - Be part of a growing, innovative UK manufacturer. - Lead quality initiatives that make a real difference. - Work in a supportive environment where your ideas and expertise are valued. - Competitive salary and benefits package. **Interested? Here are your three options**   1. "This is the job for me, I meet all the requirements" - Call now and let's talk through your experience. Ask for Jon Webster on between 8.30am - 5.30pm 2. "I think I'm right for this position, but I'm not sure about some of the detail" - Click "apply now" so I can read your CV and come back to you. 3. "I'm interested but need to know more about what this job can offer me" - email (url removed) with your CV and questions and I will reply with more detail.  Precision is committed to keeping our candidates informed and offers a guaranteed response within 7 days when applying through the application system.  **PPTP**
description_snippet: Are you a detail-driven Quality Engineer with a passion for continuous improvement and a strong understanding of ISO standards? This is an exciting opportunity to join a forward thinking electronics manufacturer, where you'll play a key role in driving quality excellence across all areas of the business. As a Quality Engineer, you'll take ownership of the company's Quality Management System (QMS), ensuring compliance to ISO 9001 and supporting implementation of ISO 14001 and ISO 45001 standards. You'll lead both internal and external audits, oversee non conformance processes, and provide hands-on support across the business to promote a culture of quality and continuous improvement. Working closely with production, suppliers, and customers, you'll manage warranty investigations, ensure compliance with environmental and safety regulations, and help maintain the highest levels of product integrity.
responsibilities_snippet:
- Administer, develop and maintain the company QMS in line with ISO 9001 standards.
- Support implementation and compliance with ISO 14001 and ISO 45001.
- Conduct and manage internal and external quality audits.
- Manage non-conformance reporting, root cause analysis and 8D corrective actions.
- Handle warranty adjudication - including receipt, assessment and logging.
- Support the development and documentation of SOPs and business processes.
- Drive continuous improvement through lean and problem-solving methodologies.
- Ensure customer and supplier compliance with standards such as REACH, RoHS and ESG.
- Prepare and manage quality documentation including PPAP, APQP, Control Plans, FMEA and SQA processes.
- Facilitate and support external audits and compliance checks.

**Skills and Requirements:**
- Proven experience within a Quality Engineering role, ideally in an electronics or manufacturing environment.
- Strong understanding of ISO 9001, with exposure to ISO 14001 and ISO 45001.
- Experience with PLM/ERP systems and customer compliance standards (REACH, RoHS, ESG).
- A tenacious, detail-oriented approach and commitment to "right first time" quality.
- Excellent problem-solving skills with experience in root cause analysis and corrective actions.
- A proactive attitude towards continuous improvement and customer satisfaction.

full_job_description: Quality Inspector – Day Shift (Permanent) Location: Leicester Salary: Up to £33,500 + Healthcare | 4-Day Working Week Immediate starts available The Role We’re looking for an experienced Quality Inspector to join a leading precision engineering company in Leicester. You’ll be carrying out first-off and first principle inspections, checking machined components to tight tolerances, and producing accurate reports using inspection software. What You’ll Do - Perform mechanical inspection of precision components - Use micrometers, verniers, height gauges and other tools - Read and interpret technical drawings - Complete documentation and inspection reports accurately - Follow the Quality Management System - Support continuous improvement and internal audits What We’re Looking For - Proven inspection experience in aerospace, precision engineering, or automotive - Confident with tight tolerances and measurement tools - Strong attention to detail and numeracy - Positive attitude and a commitment to quality and safety Why Apply? - Up to £33,500 per year - 4-day working week (Mon–Thurs) - Full shift paid – no breaks deducted - Flexible start/finish times (within reason) - Permanent role with job security - Free parking & easy commute - Healthcare and great company perks - Supportive team and excellent development opportunities Apply Today We’re holding immediate interviews. Click Apply to send your CV over to Lucy at Elite People Recruitment Services

full_job_description: About the Company: A well-established engineering and manufacturing business, recognised for producing high-quality sheet metal and fabricated components for a range of industries. With ongoing investment in modern machinery and a commitment to developing their people, they're now seeking an experienced Press Brake Setter Operator to join their team. The Press Brake Setter Operator Role: As a Press Brake Setter Operator, you'll be responsible for setting, operating, and adjusting CNC press brake machines to produce precision sheet metal parts in line with customer specifications. Key Responsibilities: - Set and operate CNC press brake machines (Amada, Bystronic, Trumpf, or similar). - Read and interpret technical drawings and engineering plans. - Carry out first-off inspections and ensure quality throughout production. - Adjust machine settings and tooling to achieve accurate folds and dimensions. - Maintain equipment, report faults, and ensure safe working practices. - Work efficiently to meet production targets and deadlines. About You - Proven experience setting and operating CNC press brakes. - Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings. - Positive, proactive attitude with good communication skills. Apply Now To apply for the Press Brake Setter Operator position, click Apply Now and upload your CV. One of our qualified consultants will be in touch to discuss your application and next steps. Apply Now

salary_benefits: £28,000 - £35,000/annum. Up to £35,000 DOE. Daytime hours: typically between 08:00–19:00. Opportunities for growth within a creative, design-led concept. Supportive and inspiring working culture.
full_job_description:
Assistant General Manager
Leicester City Centre
Up to £35,000 DOE
Full-Time, Daytime Hours, Weekends Essential
 Do you want to progress into a General Manager role within the next 6 months?
 Our client is a Scandinavian–New York inspired brunch restaurant built on friendship, connection, and exceptional coffee. Their calm, design-led space offers a welcoming home for people who appreciate craft — from perfectly pulled espresso shots to beautifully plated brunch dishes. Due to their growth, they are expanding their leadership team and are looking for an ambitious professional to join their team. This role is ideal for a seasoned hospitality manager with strong barista skills and a passion for people.
The role
Assistant General Manager
- Oversee daily operations, service flow, and team performance.
- Uphold high standards of coffee, food, and atmosphere.
- Manage compliance, rotas, stock control, and reporting.
- Lead by example during busy brunch periods.
- Manage stock control, cost efficiency and supplier orders.
Senior Barista (essential)
- Lead all aspects of coffee preparation, training, and quality control.
- Support daily operations, rotas, and guest experience alongside the GM.
- Act as floor lead when the GM is away.
- Maintain EHO and hygiene compliance with precision and care.
- Maintain excellent customer service ensuring all issues are resolved
The candidate:
- Minimum 2 years’ management experience in a premium café, brunch restaurant, or boutique hospitality setting.
- Minimum 2 years’ barista experience, ideally at senior or lead level.
- Basic food hygiene or EHO knowledge desirable
- Confident in workflow management and team leadership.
- Weekend availability essential.
What is on offer:
- Competitive pay (based on experience)
- Daytime hours: typically between 08:00–19:00
- Opportunities for growth within a creative, design-led concept
- Supportive and inspiring working culture
Interested? Please click ‘Apply’ today!

full_job_description:
Want to see your welds make a real impact?
If you’ve got MIG welding experience and want to join a company that actually invests in your skills, this is the one. You’ll be working on high quality sheet metal projects for major customers, using modern equipment in a clean, organised workshop where precision and pride really matter.
This is a busy, long established manufacturer in Loughborough with around 100 staff and a full order book stretching well into next year. They’re known locally for looking after their people, promoting from within and offering genuine training opportunities to help you progress in your career.
Job Title:	MIG Welder  
Location:	Loughborough, Leicestershire  
Hours:	Rotating shifts Monday to Friday, 06:00-14:00 / 14:00-22:00  
Contract Type:	Permanent  
Pay:	£14.00 - £15.50 per hour (based on experience, reviewed after probation)  
Benefits:
Profit Share Scheme, Multi Skilled Bonus (£1/hr extra), Overtime Pay Premiums, 30 Days Holiday (Including Bank Holidays), Enhanced Sick Pay and Healthcare Plan, Group Life Cover, Clear Career Progression Path, Training and Upskilling Opportunities, Internal Promotion Opportunities and Cycle to Work Scheme.
Your Responsibilities:
- Carry out MIG welding on sheet metal components, ensuring strong and accurate welds
- Set up and adjust welding equipment for various materials and specifications
- Read and interpret engineering drawings to achieve precise, consistent results
- Perform quality checks using measuring tools to verify weld integrity
- Support grinding and finishing of welded components as required
What We’re Looking For:
- Proven experience in MIG welding within a manufacturing or fabrication environment
- Ability to interpret drawings and produce accurate, high quality welds
- Competence with grinders, finishing tools and fabrication equipment
- A good eye for detail and pride in producing clean, professional work
- Reliable, adaptable and confident working both independently and as part of a team
Recruitment Process:
To apply, simply upload your CV below or contact Josh Whitmore on (phone number removed) or (url removed)
Successful candidates will then be invited to an onsite interview and MIG welding skills test with the Team Leader.
Ready to take your welding career further with a company that values your craft?
*Your Recruiters Ltd is an equal opportunity employer, celebrating diversity and inclusion at every level. All applications receive a personal response, with detailed feedback for anyone interviewed but unsuccessful.*

salary_benefits:
£55,000 - £60,000/annum
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to lead innovative engineering projects with real impact.
A supportive environment with autonomy, variety, and career growth potential.

full_job_description:
A growing engineering business specialising in the design and manufacture of bespoke automation and mechanical systems is seeking an experienced Engineering Project Manager to join its expanding team. The company operates across regulated and industrial sectors, delivering complex, high-precision systems that meet demanding technical and regulatory standards.
As a well-established and employee-focused organisation, the business continues to invest in innovation and people, with a strong pipeline of new projects and long-term customer partnerships.
**The Role**
As Engineering Project Manager, you’ll take ownership of multiple projects from initial concept through to final delivery. You will oversee planning, coordination, and execution across mechanical, electrical, software, and build disciplines—ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.
This is a hands-on, delivery-focused position that requires both technical understanding and strong commercial acumen. You’ll work closely with customers, engineering teams, and senior stakeholders to drive accountability and successful outcomes across the full project lifecycle.
**Key Responsibilities**
- Lead and manage several concurrent engineering projects (typically 3–4 at a time) from concept through to completion.
- Ensure all projects meet contractual and commercial milestones, including agreed payment stages.
- Take ownership of project budgets, costings, and margins.
- Plan and allocate resources effectively across design, build, and commissioning teams.
- Lead structured design reviews and ensure adherence to engineering standards and compliance requirements.
- Act as the main customer contact throughout the project, managing scope changes, risks, and technical queries.
- Ensure projects meet internal quality, documentation, and handover standards.
- Drive continuous improvement across processes, design delivery, and communication.
**About You**
We’re looking for an experienced and proactive Project Manager with a strong background in automation, machinery, or special-purpose equipment design. You’ll be commercially aware, technically capable, and confident managing cross-functional teams and customers in a dynamic environment.
**Key Skills & Experience**
- Degree-qualified in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline.
- Minimum 10 years’ experience managing engineering or automation projects.
- Strong technical understanding of automated systems, robotics, or machinery.
- Proven experience in regulated or high-precision industries (medical, healthcare, packaging, etc.).
- Confident managing budgets, timelines, and multi-disciplinary engineering teams.
- Skilled communicator with the ability to manage stakeholders at all levels.
- Proficient in Microsoft Project or similar project management tools.
**Personal Attributes**
- Hands-on and delivery-focused with a strong sense of ownership.
- Collaborative, calm under pressure, and customer-oriented.
- Able to balance technical, commercial, and operational priorities effectively.
- Willingness to travel occasionally within the UK and overseas.
**What’s on Offer**
- Competitive salary and benefits package.
- Opportunity to lead innovative engineering projects with real impact.
- A supportive environment with autonomy, variety, and career growth potential.
- Work within a forward-thinking, employee-driven business investing in technology and people.
If this role would be of interest to you, please click apply today.

full_job_description: The Toolroom Manager Role: We are currently seeking a driven and committed Toolroom Manager to join our growing team. This position has become available due to continued business growth, with projected expansion of over 50% in the next year. We're looking for motivated individuals to help us meet this demand. We take pride in maintaining a clean, organised, and professional toolroom. The successful candidate will play a key role in sustaining and improving standards of organisation, cleanliness, and overall presentation. Liaise with the customer to understand their needs within a project and communicate this clearly to the design and manufacturing team. Tool design, Mould flow and DFM interrogation to check feasibility and suitability of the design against the customers and moulders needs. Understand and interrogate part and tool designs for manufacturability and efficiency Assign daily workload to the shopfloor staff and explain each job to them as required Troubleshoot manufacturing issues from CNC machining, EDM machining and fitting issues. Monitor progress and provide regular updates to customers Create project plans showing the timeline of key activities in the project Attend the final tool build checklist with the fitting team, making sure the quality standards are met before we despatch tooling to customers Buying of mould bases, standard mould parts, cutting tools and other workshop equipment. Project management of Chinese tooling, communicating with our project managers oversees to check progress and quality. International travel could be available but not essential. Attend tool trials and provide support to the process team for troubleshooting Review parts from trials and understand injection moulding process/tooling defects Create tooling rework plans and oversee trial loop until approved About You: Strong technical background in plastics and tooling Experience in interpreting 2D and 3D engineering drawings Background in tool design, mould flow analysis, and DFM reviews Involvement in managing varied tooling projects from start to finish Hands-on experience with CNC machining, EDM, and tool fitting processes Proven people management and organisational skills Excellent attention to detail and quality standards Flexibility to adapt to different projects and changing priorities Strong communication skills to liaise with customers and internal teams Ability to create and manage project timelines and tooling plans

Project management of Chinese tooling, communicating with our project managers oversees to check progress and quality. International travel could be available but not essential. Attend tool trials and provide support to the process team for troubleshooting Review parts from trials and understand injection moulding process/tooling defects Create tooling rework plans and oversee trial loop until approved Play a key role in sustaining and improving standards of organisation, cleanliness, and overall presentation. Skills and Requirements: Strong technical background in plastics and tooling Experience in interpreting 2D and 3D engineering drawings Background in tool design, mould flow analysis, and DFM reviews Involvement in managing varied tooling projects from start to finish Hands-on experience with CNC machining, EDM, and tool fitting processes Proven people management and organisational skills Excellent attention to detail and quality standards Flexibility to adapt to different projects and changing priorities Strong communication skills to liaise with customers and internal teams Ability to create and manage project timelines and tooling plans

salary_benefits: Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE). Benefits: Quarterly bonus scheme (non-contractual), Life assurance, Enhanced holiday entitlement with service-linked increases, Pension scheme, Company-provided workwear and PPE, On-site gym, canteen, and parking, Employee Assistance Programme, Continuous training and career development opportunities.
full_job_description:
Job Opportunity: CAD/CAM Engineer (Sheet Metal Manufacturing)
Location: Leicester, East Midlands
Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE)
Hours: Monday - Thursday, 07:30 - 16:00 (40 hours per week), Friday 12:30 Finish
Type: Permanent, Full-Time
Start Date: Immediate

About the Company
Our client is a leading UK metal manufacturing specialist, they partner with major national brands across industries such as rail, transport, retail, and construction.
A family-run business, they pride themselves on their commitment to quality, investment in cutting-edge technology, and dedication to developing their people. With over 100 skilled employees, the company continues to grow year-on-year thanks to its focus on innovation, craftsmanship, and exceptional customer service.

The Role: CAD/CAM Engineer
As a CAD/CAM Engineer, you will play a crucial role in producing high-quality and dimensionally accurate engineering drawings and CNC programs for the manufacturing of sheet metal components. You will work closely with production and clients to ensure orders meet technical specifications, efficiency standards, and quality expectations.

Key Responsibilities
- Create accurate 2D CAD/CAM profiles in line with client specifications.
- Develop CNC programs that maximise efficiency in material use and machine time.
- Produce detailed manufacturing drawings for press, fabrication, and assembly operations.
- Update and modify CAD/CNC data as required.
- Maintain organised drawing and program records.
- Communicate clearly with clients regarding order details and requirements.
- Prepare Bill of Materials (BOM) lists for the purchasing team to ensure all project materials are available.

Skills & Experience
Essential:
- Proficiency in 2D CAD software (AutoCAD or TruTops preferred).
- Strong SolidWorks experience (sheet metal design essential).
- Solid understanding of sheet metal manufacturing processes.
- Confident user of MS Office / Office 365, particularly Excel and Teams.
Desirable:
- Experience with Trumpf CAM software (advantageous but not essential).

Personal Attributes
- Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in work.
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Professional, approachable, and adaptable attitude.
- Focused and reliable under pressure.
- Innovative problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
- Enthusiastic about developing a long-term career in manufacturing.

Benefits
- Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE).
- Quarterly bonus scheme (non-contractual).
- Life assurance.
- Enhanced holiday entitlement with service-linked increases.
- Pension scheme.
- Company-provided workwear and PPE.
- On-site gym, canteen, and parking.
- Employee Assistance Programme.
- Continuous training and career development opportunities.

About Regional Recruitment Services
This role is advertised by Regional Recruitment Services Ltd, an award-winning independent recruitment agency established in 2008. We specialise in connecting skilled professionals to opportunities across the Engineering, Industrial, and Technical sectors.
Contact Us: (phone number removed)
Visit: (url removed)
If you are passionate about precision engineering and want to progress your career with a respected and growing manufacturer, apply today or call our Industrial team for more details.
